description.raw:
Potential fix for [gazebo issue #740](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/740/gzsdf-urdf-parser-ignores-properties-for).

@bit-pirate , can you try this out?

With this change and gazebo built from `gazebo_1.9`, `gzsdf print kobuki.urdf > test.sdf` gives me the following output, which looks promising:

~~~
    <link name='base_footprint'>
    [...]
      <collision name='base_footprint_collision_caster_back_link'>
        <pose>-0.135 0 0.0192 -1.5708 0 0</pose>
        <geometry>
          <cylinder>
            <length>0.0176</length>
            <radius>0.017</radius>
          </cylinder>
        </geometry>
        <surface>
          <contact>
            <ode>
              <kp>1e+08</kp>
              <kd>10000</kd>
            </ode>
          </contact>
          <friction>
            <ode>
              <mu>0</mu>
              <mu2>0</mu2>
            </ode>
          </friction>
        </surface>
      </collision>
      <collision name='base_footprint_collision_caster_front_link'>
        <pose>0.115 0 0.0172 -1.5708 0 0</pose>
        <geometry>
          <cylinder>
            <length>0.0176</length>
            <radius>0.017</radius>
          </cylinder>
        </geometry>
        <surface>
          <contact>
            <ode>
              <kp>1e+08</kp>
              <kd>10000</kd>
            </ode>
          </contact>
          <friction>
            <ode>
              <mu>0</mu>
              <mu2>0</mu2>
            </ode>
          </friction>
        </surface>
      </collision>
~~~

title.raw: Look for the synthesized collision body name when inserting gazebo extension data

description:
Potential fix for [gazebo issue #740](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/740/gzsdf-urdf-parser-ignores-properties-for).

@bit-pirate , can you try this out?

With this change and gazebo built from `gazebo_1.9`, `gzsdf print kobuki.urdf > test.sdf` gives me the following output, which looks promising:

~~~
    <link name='base_footprint'>
    [...]
      <collision name='base_footprint_collision_caster_back_link'>
        <pose>-0.135 0 0.0192 -1.5708 0 0</pose>
        <geometry>
          <cylinder>
            <length>0.0176</length>
            <radius>0.017</radius>
          </cylinder>
        </geometry>
        <surface>
          <contact>
            <ode>
              <kp>1e+08</kp>
              <kd>10000</kd>
            </ode>
          </contact>
          <friction>
            <ode>
              <mu>0</mu>
              <mu2>0</mu2>
            </ode>
          </friction>
        </surface>
      </collision>
      <collision name='base_footprint_collision_caster_front_link'>
        <pose>0.115 0 0.0172 -1.5708 0 0</pose>
        <geometry>
          <cylinder>
            <length>0.0176</length>
            <radius>0.017</radius>
          </cylinder>
        </geometry>
        <surface>
          <contact>
            <ode>
              <kp>1e+08</kp>
              <kd>10000</kd>
            </ode>
          </contact>
          <friction>
            <ode>
              <mu>0</mu>
              <mu2>0</mu2>
            </ode>
          </friction>
        </surface>
      </collision>
~~~
title: Look for the synthesized collision body name when inserting gazebo extension data
